member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataFormsMessageStrings.ParseFailed_S

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt
member.summary: Extend the data manager with some convenient dialog spawning options.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenVector(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This opens a file, but populates the dialog filter with only raster formats.
member.returns: An IFeatureSet with the data from the file specified in a dialog

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenVectors(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This uses an open dialog filter with only raster extensions but where multi-select is enabled, hence allowing multiple rasters to be returned in this list.
member.returns: The list or rasters

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenImage(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This opens a file, but populates the dialog filter with only raster formats.
member.returns: for now an IDataSet

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenImages(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This uses an open dialog filter with only image extensions for supported image formats, but where multi-select is enabled, and so allowing multiple images to be returned at once.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenFile(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This launches an open file dialog and attempts to load the specified file.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenFiles(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This launches an open file dialog that allows loading of several files at once and returns the datasets in a list.
member.returns: A list of all the files that were opened

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenRaster(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This opens a file, but populates the dialog filter with only raster formats.
member.returns: An IRaster with the data from the file specified in an open file dialog

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.DataManagerExt.OpenRasters(DotSpatial.Data.IDataManager)
member.summary: This uses an open dialog filter with only raster extensions but where multi-select is enabled, hence allowing multiple rasters to be returned in this list.
member.returns: The list or rasters

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger
member.summary: Implementing this interface will allow the plugin developer to intercept the different log levels.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.Exception(System.Exception)
member.summary: The Complete exception is passed here. To get the stack trace, be sure to call ex.ToString().
member.param: The exception that was thrown by DotSpatial.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.PublicMethodEntered(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: This event will allow the registering of an entrance into a public Method of a "tools" related action to register its entrance into a function as well as logging the parameter names and a type specific indicator of their value.
member.param: The string name of the method
The list of calling parameters

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.PublicMethodLeft(System.String)
member.summary: This event will allow the registering of the exit from each public method
member.param: The Method name of the method being left

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.Status(System.String)
member.summary: A status message was sent. Complex methods that have a few major steps will call a status message to show which step the process is in. Loops will call the progress method instead.
member.param: The string message that was posted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.MessageBoxShown(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult)
member.summary: This method allows a user to recieve messages that were shown to the user, as well as their choice on those message boxes.
member.param: A MessageBox after it has resolved.
A DialogResult from showing a message

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.InputBoxShown(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult,System.String)
member.summary: This method allows the logger to recieve information about input boxes that were shown as well as the values enterred into them and the result.
member.param: The string message that appeared on the InputBox
The ystem.Windows.Forms.DialogResult describing if the value was cancelled
The string containing the value entered.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.Description
member.summary: Gets a string description for this logger.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger.Key
member.summary: Gets or Sets an integer key to keep track of this logger. When you add this logger to a LogManager, it will attempt to keep track of the logger by using the key it was given. If that key is already in use, this will be set to the next available integer.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager
member.summary: This component allows customization of how log messages are sent

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.AddLogger(DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger)
member.summary: To begin logging, create an implementation of the ILogHandler interface, or use the DefaultLogger class that is already implemented in this project. Then, call this function to add that logger to the list of active loggers. This function will return an integer key that you can use to keep track of your specific logger.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.RemoveLogger(System.Int32)
member.summary: The key specified here is the key that was returned by the AddLogger method.
member.param: The integer key of the logger to remove.
member.returns: True if the logger was successfully removed, or false if the key could not be found

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.AddLoggersFromDirectories
member.summary: Adds all the loggers from directories.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.Exception(System.Exception)
member.summary: The Complete exception is passed here. To get the stack trace, be sure to call ex.ToString().
member.param: The exception that was thrown by DotSpatial.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.PublicMethodEntered(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This event will allow the registering of an entrance into a public Method of a "tools" related action to register its entrance into a function as well as logging the parameter names and a type specific indicator of their value.
member.param: The string name of the method
The List<string> of Parameter names and string form values

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.PublicMethodLeft(System.String)
member.summary: This event will allow the registering of the exit from each public method
member.param: The Method name of the method being left

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.Status(System.String)
member.summary: A status message was sent. Complex methods that have a few major steps will call a status message to show which step the process is in. Loops will call the progress method instead.
member.param: The string message that was posted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogManager.LogMessage(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult)
member.summary: This is called by each of the LogMessageBox methods automatically, but if the user wants to use a custom messagebox and then log the message and result directly this is the technique.
member.param: The string text of the message that needs to be logged.
The dialog result from the shown messagebox.

member.summary: This method echoes information about input boxes to all the loggers.

The ystem.Windows.Forms.DialogResult describing if the value was cancelled
The string containing the value entered.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager
member.summary: This component allows customization of how log messages are sent

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager._components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.DefaultLogManager
member.summary: This ensures that there will always be some kind of log manager. When a new LogManager is created, this static is set to be that instance. Controlling the DefaultLogManager will control which log manager is actively in use.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the LogManager.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.AddLogger(DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ILogger)
member.summary: To begin logging, create an implementation of the ILogHandler interface, or use the DefaultLogger class that is already implemented in this project. Then, call this function to add that logger to the list of active loggers. This function will return an integer key that you can use to keep track of your specific logger.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.RemoveLogger(System.Int32)
member.summary: The key specified here is the key that was returned by the AddLogger method.
member.param: The integer key of the logger to remove.
member.returns: True if the logger was successfully removed, or false if the key could not be found

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.AddLoggersFromDirectories
member.summary: Adds all the loggers from directories.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.Exception(System.Exception)
member.summary: The Complete exception is passed here. To get the stack trace, be sure to call ex.ToString().
member.param: The exception that was thrown by DotSpatial.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.PublicMethodEntered(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This event will allow the registering of an entrance into a public Method of a "tools" related action to register its entrance into a function as well as logging the parameter names and a type specific indicator of their value.
member.param: The string name of the method
The List<string> of Parameter names and string form values

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.PublicMethodLeft(System.String)
member.summary: This event will allow the registering of the exit from each public method
member.param: The Method name of the method being left

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.Status(System.String)
member.summary: A status message was sent. Complex methods that have a few major steps will call a status message to show which step the process is in. Loops will call the progress method instead.
member.param: The string message that was posted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.Progress(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: A progress message, generally as part of a long loop was sent. It is a bad idea to log these to a file as there may be thousands of them.
member.param: The status part of the progress message with no percent information
The integer percent from 0 to 100
The complete message, showing both status and completion percent

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.LogMessage(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult)
member.summary: This is called by each of the LogMessageBox methods automatically, but if the user wants to use a custom messagebox and then log the message and result directly this is the technique.
member.param: The string text of the message that needs to be logged.
The dialog result from the shown messagebox.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.LogManager.LogInput(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult,System.String)
member.summary: This method echoes information about input boxes to all the loggers.
member.param: The string message that appeared on the InputBox
The ystem.Windows.Forms.DialogResult describing if the value was cancelled
The string containing the value entered.

member.summary: Gets the modifiers that existed when this event is fired. use like if (Modifiers and Keys.Shift){}

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ShapefileExt
member.summary: Extension method for shapefile

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.ShapefileExt.OpenFile(DotSpatial.Data.Shapefile)
member.summary: This will use this object to open a shapefile, but launches an open file dialog for the user to select the file to open.
member.returns: A new Shapefile created from the file chosen by the open file dialog.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter
member.summary: This handles the methodology of progress messaging in one place to make it easier to update.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.#ctor(DotSpatial.Data.IProgressHandler,System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Constructs a Time-Based progress meter that shows progress against an expected time.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.#ctor
member.summary: Intializes a new progress meter, but doesn't support the IProgressHandler unless one is specified.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.#ctor(DotSpatial.Data.IProgressHandler)
member.summary: A progress meter can't actually do anything without a progressHandler, which actually displays the status.
member.param: An IProgressHandler that will actually handle the status messages sent by this meter.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.#ctor(DotSpatial.Data.IProgressHandler,System.String)
member.summary: A progress meter that simply keeps track of progress and is capable of sending progress messages. This assumes a MaxValue of 100 unless it is changed later.
member.param: Any valid IProgressHandler that will display progress messages
A base message to use as the basic status for this progress handler.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.#ctor(DotSpatial.Data.IProgressHandler,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: A progress meter that simply keeps track of progress and is capable of sending progress messages.
member.param: Any valid implementation if IProgressHandler that will handle the progress function
The message without any progress information.
Percent shoudl show a range between the MinValue and MaxValue. MinValue is assumed to be 0.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.Reset
member.summary: Resets the progress meter to the 0 value. This sets the status message to "Ready.".

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.SendProgress
member.summary: Sends a progress message to the IProgressHandler interface with the current message and progres

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that does not include any mention of progress percentage, but specifies what is occuring.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.CurrentPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the current integer progress level from 0 to 100. If a new update is less than or equal to the previous value, then no progress will be displayed by the ProgressMeter. Values less than 0 are set to 0. Values greater than 100 are set to 100.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.CurrentValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value relative to the specified MaxValue in order to update the progress. Setting this will also update OldProgress if there is an integer change in the percentage, and send a progress message to the IProgressHandler interface.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.EndValue
member.summary: The value that defines when the meter should show as 100% complete. EndValue can be less than StartValue, but values closer to EndValue will show as being closer to 100%.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.Silent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the progress meter should send messages to the IProgressHandler. By default Silent is false, but setting this to true will disable the messaging portion.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.StartValue
member.summary: The minimum value defines when the meter should show as 0% complete.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.StepPercent
member.summary: An integer value that is 1 by default. Ordinarilly this will send a progress message only when the integer progress has changed by 1 percentage point. For example, if StepPercent were set to 5, then a progress update would only be sent out at 5%, 10% and so on. This helps reduce overhead in cases where showing status messages is actually the majority of the processing time for the function.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.PreviousPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the previous integer progress level from 0 to 100. If a new update is less than or equal to the previous value, then no progress will be displayed by the ProgressMeter. Values less than 0 are set to 0. Values greater than 100 are set to 100.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TimedProgressMeter.ProgressHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the progress handler for this meter

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument
member.summary: TryXmlDocument

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of TryXmlDocument

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.NavigateToChild(System.String)
member.summary: This changes CurrentNode to the child node with the specified name. If there are no child nodes, or the child node is not found, this returns false. If the navigation is successful, this returns true.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.NavigateToParent
member.summary: Attempts to navigate to the parent.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the specified

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.ReadText(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to read the string for the specified value. This will first test to see if the attribute exists and encloses the test in a try block. If it fails or the node does not exist, the default value is returned.
member.param: The string name for the attribute to read from the CurrentElement.
member.returns: A string specifying the value

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.ReadColor(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to read the color from a text representation of an argb integer value.
member.param: The name of the attribute to read from the CurrentElement
member.returns: A Color structure

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.ReadBool(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to read the boolean value from the specified attribute, translating it from a text equivalent.
member.param: The string name of the attribute to read from the CurrentElement
member.returns: A boolean value based on parsing the text.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.ReadInteger(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to read the integer value from the specified attribute, translating it from a text equivalent via parsing.
member.param: The string name of the attribute to read from the CurrentElement
member.returns: An integer parsed from the inner text of the specified attribute on the CurrentElement

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.ReadDouble(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to read the double value from the specified attribute, translating it from a text equivalent via parsing.
member.param: The string name of the attribute to read from the CurrentElement
member.returns: A double value parsed from the inner text of the specified attribute on the CurrentElement

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets the fileName for this document.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the XmlDocument that this class uses for data access.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Data.Forms.TryXmlDocument.CurrentElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the current node that should be referenced for reading attributes.
